info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 2:17PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Berkshire and central Columbia Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 216 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Philmont, or 7 miles southeast of Hudson, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Great Barrington, Lee, Lenox, Philmont, Housatonic, Stockbridge, Hillsdale, Taghkanic, Monterey, Alford, Hartsville, Mahkeenac Heights, Mellenville, Craryville, Newsboy Statue, Glendale, Tanglewood, North Hillsdale, Williamsville and Harlemville. People attending Tanglewood should seek safe shelter immediately! MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for western Massachusetts...and east central New York.
